job_description: R12957 Temp Statistical Programming Contractor - job post Regeneron 333 reviews 777 Old Saw Mill River Rd, Tarrytown, NY 10591 Temporary, Contract Regeneron 333 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Temporary Contract R12957 Temp Statistical Programming Contractor Pay Range: Min $ 60.25- Max $ 83.09 The Temporary Statistical Programmer Provides support to the lead programmer and the study team on all programming activities according to the study requirements and the timelines. This role assists on studies in various therapeutical areas and all clinical trial phases. You will implement and completes the programming and project standard under general supervision of the management to support ongoing clinical studies and requests for study report, regulatory submission, and ad hoc/post hoc analysis. Maintains programming documentations such as study tracker, code, logs, and analysis outputs in a regulated environment. You may participate in and support department goals and SME topics. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Provide programming support within multiple studies/projects in various study activities with timely and high-quality programming results as assigned tasks and projects Work with your manager in cross-functional collaborations to support the study conduct and reporting activities. Maintain all documentation in accordance with SOPs/Guidance/WI/process to ensure traceability and regulatory compliance Participate and contribute towards department goals and SME topics This role may be for you if: Follow Regeneron processes and policies around retention of data, records, and information for clinical trials. Show dedication to and perform consistently to ensure high quality results. You have had exposure to relational database structure. You have understanding of reporting systems and experience with implementing standardization methodology To be considered you'll need a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related field with 1 to 3 years of programming experience, preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. An advanced degree is preferred. SAS Certification a plus. Experience in SAS programming, preferably in a clinical data environment. This is a contract position at Regeneron with Magnit Global being the Employer. W2 only, no third party solicitation To do our best work we need different viewpoints. Therefore, we celebrate diversity and embrace inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, we are dedicated to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strive to ensure that we maintain a positive and enriching work environment for all.
